item.title: 6 diddle displacements
item.description: La video de Quincy Davis. Why? Freer application of diddles Better organized stickings Speed/fluidity (bring accents out) Playing inner partials Exercises Snare only Paradiddle displacement Paradiddles restart one 16th later every bar.

item.title: A Dave Weckl lick
item.description: La video de Darryn Farrugia. 1 RLR KLR KLL Les LR`` sont sur les toms, le LL`` sur la caisse claire.

item.title: Creative Drum and Bass
item.description: La video de JP Bouvet. Step 1, Short and long patterns Short (on the 2) 1 2 3 4 5 X:1 T:short 1 M:4/4 L:1/8 |: C2 B2 CC BC | zC B2 CC B2 :| 1 2 3 4 5 X:2 T:short 2 M:4/4 L:1/8 |: CC B2 C2 BC | zC B2 CC B2 :| Long (on the 2s) QQ.

item.title: Creatively incorporate your kick drum into fills
item.description: The video of the Non Glamorousdrummer. Me Exhaustive but not always idiomatic. Kind of idiomatic when singles and doubles start with hands and paradiddles start with kick.

item.title: Establishing a flow foundation
item.description: La video de JP Bouvet. Down-up method (RH-lead) The RLLK subset Controlling RLK

item.title: Favorite warm-up of 2023
item.description: La video de Mike Johnston. RlrRll RllrrL RlRlRR LrLrLL para diddle diddle «6 strokes roll» (not to me) double paradiddles (RH lead then LH lead)

item.title: Number one advice from drummers
item.description: Video de Zack Grooves Le mec de BB King : être attentif à tout (oreilles, yeux), tout prendre, être versatile
